resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

lihalite commented on issue #3370: [ARROW-4230] Fix Flight builds with gRPC/Protobuf/c-ares
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3370#issuecomment-453173511
 
 
   @wesm of course, created [ARROW-4230](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4230).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

users@infra.apache.org

lihalite commented on issue #3370: ARROW-4230: [C++] Fix Flight builds with gRPC/Protobuf/c-ares
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3370#issuecomment-453204142
 
 
   Hmm, I think I'm misunderstanding - `GRPC_HOME` exists, but it's used with `find_package(CONFIG)`, so gRPC must be installed with CMake. This adds `FindgRPC.cmake` so that a non-CMake installation will also work. The reason why you see `gRPC_DIR` in the example invocation is because that's a CMake-defined variable for the search path in case you do want to use a CMake-built gRPC.
   
   I missed the part where the `_HOME` variables were set from the environment, so I will add a similar statement for `CARES_HOME` and fix the README section I added.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #3370: ARROW-4230: [C++] Fix Flight builds with gRPC/Protobuf/c-ares
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3370#issuecomment-453205835
 
 
   > This adds FindgRPC.cmake so that a non-CMake installation will also work. 
   
   I'm a bit surprised. I set `RE2_HOME=/usr` to use Ubuntu's system install of re2, yet `find_package` seems to work fine. There does not seem to be any re2-specific cmake file installed.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on issue #3370: ARROW-4230: [C++] Fix Flight builds with gRPC/Protobuf/c-ares
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3370#issuecomment-453206447
 
 
   Ah, but we have a `FindRE2.cmake`. Got it. Yet more boilerplate in the build files ;-)
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

lihalite commented on issue #3370: ARROW-4230: [C++] Fix Flight builds with gRPC/Protobuf/c-ares
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3370#issuecomment-453206776
 
 
   Yup, unfortunately :/ I think the other difference is that `find_package(gRPC CONFIG REQUIRED)` explicitly looks for a CMake-generated install vs `find_package(RE2 REQURIED)` which only looks for -some- re2 install. And for gRPC we need to know a little more about the package (to get the path to the protoc plugin, for instance).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #3370: ARROW-4230: [C++] Fix Flight builds with gRPC/Protobuf/c-ares
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3370#discussion_r246879899
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -89,6 +89,10 @@ if (DEFINED ENV{GRPC_HOME})
   set(GRPC_HOME "$ENV{GRPC_HOME}")
 endif()
 
+if (DEFINED ENV{CARES_HOME})
 
 Review comment:
   It would be nice to keep those directives in lexographical order.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the

pitrou commented on pull request #3370: ARROW-4230: [C++] Fix Flight builds with gRPC/Protobuf/c-ares
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3370#discussion_r246880693
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -1243,31 +1249,56 @@ if (ARROW_FLIGHT)
       ${EP_LOG_OPTIONS}
       CMAKE_ARGS ${GRPC_CMAKE_ARGS}
       ${EP_LOG_OPTIONS})
-    include_directories(SYSTEM ${GRPC_INCLUDE_DIR})
+
+    set(GPR_STATIC_LIB "${GRPC_STATIC_LIBRARY_GPR}")
+    set(GRPC_STATIC_LIB "${GRPC_STATIC_LIBRARY_GRPC}")
+    set(GRPCPP_STATIC_LIB "${GRPC_STATIC_LIBRARY_GRPCPP}")
+    set(GRPC_ADDRESS_SORTING_STATIC_LIB "${GRPC_STATIC_LIBRARY_ADDRESS_SORTING}")
+    # XXX(wesm): relying on vendored c-ares provided by gRPC for the time being
+    set(CARES_STATIC_LIB "${GRPC_STATIC_LIBRARY_CARES}")
+    set(GRPC_CPP_PLUGIN "${GRPC_BUILD_DIR}/${CMAKE_CFG_INTDIR}/grpc_cpp_plugin")
+    # get_property(GPR_STATIC_LIB TARGET gRPC::gpr PROPERTY LOCATION)
+    # get_property(GRPC_STATIC_LIB TARGET gRPC::grpc_unsecure PROPERTY LOCATION)
+    # get_property(GRPCPP_STATIC_LIB TARGET gRPC::grpc++_unsecure PROPERTY LOCATION)
+    # get_property(GRPC_ADDRESS_SORTING_STATIC_LIB
+    #   TARGET gRPC::address_sorting PROPERTY LOCATION)
+    # # XXX(wesm): relying on vendored c-ares provided by gRPC for the time being
+    # get_property(CARES_STATIC_LIB TARGET c-ares::cares_static PROPERTY LOCATION)
+    # # Get location of grpc_cpp_plugin so we can pass it to protoc
+    # get_property(GRPC_CPP_PLUGIN TARGET gRPC::grpc_cpp_plugin PROPERTY LOCATION)
   else()
-    find_package(gRPC CONFIG REQUIRED)
+    find_package(gRPC REQUIRED)
     set(GRPC_VENDORED 0)
   endif()
 
-  get_property(GPR_STATIC_LIB TARGET gRPC::gpr PROPERTY LOCATION)
+  # If we built gRPC ourselves, we should use its c-ares.
+  if ("${CARES_STATIC_LIB}" STREQUAL "")
 
 Review comment:
   I do not see `CARES_STATIC_LIB` used anywhere in our build files. Am I missing something?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on pull request #3370: ARROW-4230: [C++] Fix Flight builds with gRPC/Protobuf/c-ares
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3370#discussion_r246881476
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/README.md
 ##########
 @@ -311,6 +311,45 @@ ctest -L gandiva
 This library is still in Alpha stages, and subject to API changes without
 deprecation warnings.
 
+### Building and developing Flight (optional)
+
+In addition to the Arrow dependencies, Flight requires:
+* gRPC
+* Protobuf
+* c-ares
+
+By default, Arrow will try to download and build these dependencies
+when building Flight.
+
+The optional `flight` libraries and tests can be built by passing
+`-DARROW_FLIGHT=ON`.
+
+```shell
+cmake .. -DARROW_FLIGHT=ON -DARROW_BUILD_TESTS=ON
+make
+```
+
+You can also use existing installations of the extra dependencies.
+When building, set the environment variables `GRPC_HOME` and/or
+`PROTOBUF_HOME` and/or `CARES_HOME`.
+
+On Ubuntu/Debian, you can install these dependencies with:
 
 Review comment:
   Something missing here? On Ubuntu 18.04, one might get away with (untested):
   ```
   apt install libgrpc++-dev
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

bissont commented on issue #3370: ARROW-4230: [C++] Fix Flight builds with gRPC/Protobuf/c-ares
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3370#issuecomment-453263264
 
 
   Thanks for this! Just tested and it does build the arrowflight library with a cmake -DARROW_FLIGHT=ON; make, but if you turn -DARROW_BUILD_TESTS=ON, cmake fails:
   
   CMake Error at src/arrow/flight/CMakeLists.txt:89 (add_dependencies):
     Cannot add target-level dependencies to non-existent target "flight-test".
   
     The add_dependencies works for top-level logical targets created by the
     add_executable, add_library, or add_custom_target commands.  If you want to
     add file-level dependencies see the DEPENDS option of the add_custom_target
     and add_custom_command commands.
   
   
   -- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
   
   
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Right now Flight assumes that gRPC is vendored or that it is installed with CMake. It would be easier to build if it accepted other installations of gRPC, such as ones from Conda (eventually) or system package managers.
fields.summary: [C++] Enable building flight against system gRPC
